Sequence Information.Source: identified in the EST database,Trichoplax adhaerens

Literature Information.Literature: 41.6% similar toPhylloseptin-H9andNRC-10.The peptide was identified from Trichoplax adhaerens, the only described species in the phylum Placozoa, structurally simplest multicellular animal.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus (MRSA), L. ivanovii (MIC 3 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 12.5 uM), Gram- bacteria E. coli ATCC 25922, P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853, A. baumannii ATCC 19606, K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 3-6 uM),  fungi C. albicans ATCC 90028 and C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 25-50 uM). This peptide showed a relatively good cell selectivity index (65-260). Trichoplaxin is random in water but helical in the presence of membrane-mimetic models such as SDS or TFE. Reg. 9/2014; 12/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Simunic J, Petrov D, Bouceba T, Kamech N, Benincasa M, Juretic D.2014
Literature Information.Title: Trichoplaxin - a new membrane-active antimicrobial peptide from placozoan cDNA.
